channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-16341] Missing bit on "Regression: Random Read/WorkloadC slower in 1.x than 0.98"
item.description:
Lars George found a missing bit in HBASE-15971 "Regression: Random Read/WorkloadC slower in 1.x than 0.98" Let me fix here. Let me quote the man:


BTW, in constructor we do this



```    String callQueueType = conf.get(CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_CONF_KEY,

        CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_FIFO_CONF_VALUE);

```

(edited)



[8:19]  

but in `onConfigurationChange()` we do



```    String callQueueType = conf.get(CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_CONF_KEY,

      CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_DEADLINE_CONF_VALUE);

```

(edited)
item.summary: Missing bit on "Regression: Random Read/WorkloadC slower in 1.x than 0.98"

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Small fix.

+1

Curious if this would now be seen as a compat issue on branches < branch-1. Sean Busbey Mikhail Antonov?

generally I would consider changing a default behavior to be incompatible. But if this is a significant hit and the variable is configurable, then I'd be fine with including it along with an appropriate release note that explains the tradeoff and says how to restore the prior behavior.

public static final String CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_CONF_KEY = "hbase.ipc.server.callqueue.type";

   public static final String CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_CONF_DEFAULT = CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_FIFO_CONF_VALUE;

+  public static final String CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_DEFAULT = CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_FIFO_CONF_VALUE;

+    ;

looks like an extraneous ';'. Also, what's the intended difference between CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_CONF_DEFAULT and CALL_QUEUE_TYPE_DEFAULT?
Semantically looks good to me for 1.3. Also not sure what the difference is between two settings above that Sean Busbey has pointed out.

Pardon the crappy patch. Thanks for the reviews (yeah, I did not notice that there already a default).

Once this gets a +1 and goes in, will backport to 1.3. Not sure about backporting to 1.2 since it already has a few point releases. I can.

And on HBASE-15971 in general, would be good to get 3rd party confirmation it makes as much difference as claimed since another tester sees a small improvement only, not the amount I claim.

-1 overall

HBASE-16341 Missing bit on "Regression: Random Read/WorkloadC slower in (stack: rev f320166142c00b8bb60574d3ba7b586c07c6780c)

  • (edit) hbase-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hbase/ipc/SimpleRpcScheduler.java
It appears to be that this patch has broken bunch of tests in https://builds.apache.org/view/All/job/HBase-1.3/817/, stack you think it's unrelated?
cc Gary Helmling

Seems like all the failures are like the following:

java.lang.RuntimeException: hbase-default.xml file seems to be for an older version of HBase (1.3.0-SNAPSHOT), this version is Unknown

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseConfiguration.checkDefaultsVersion(HBaseConfiguration.java:71)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseConfiguration.addHbaseResources(HBaseConfiguration.java:81)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.HBaseConfiguration.create(HBaseConfiguration.java:96)

	at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.io.crypto.TestCipherProvider.testCustomProvider(TestCipherProvider.java:126)

I don't see this simple patch changing the behavior there though. Something else change with test configurations?
It's probably the changes to the working directory path mentioned on the HBase CI / Jenkins thread. It burned everything and no one has stepped up to rework all the test jobs.
Sean Busbey is it something you are working on by chance? I'll file a jira if there's none yet.

No, I haven't had time to pick up the jenkins stuff again. I redid the branch-1.2 stuff to unblock stack, but I'd rather put my time towards getting us off of ASF infra than try to guess how they'll break our CI next.

Sean Busbey hmm I'm seeing on https://builds.apache.org/view/All/job/HBase-1.2 that builds are also failing with the same 50 broken tests.

I searched for the appropriate mail thread but couldn't find one, could you please point me out to this discussion? Having public CI basically completely broken is concerning..

the thread that covers our public CI stuff is "Testing and CI – Apache Jenkins Builds" (here's a link for the thread within this month: ref). there is also a thread on private@hbase about the state of CI resources.

I agree that public CI being in a failed state should be a high priority for the project.
Thanks Sean!
So for now I've followed the lead and created 2 projects for JDK 7 and 8, and at the same time disabled current hbase-1.3 and hbase-1.3-IT builds for now.
